intro: Discocactus diersianus var. goianus, commonly known as the Goianus discocactus, is a species native to Brazil, specifically the state of Goiás. It is a small, spineless cactus characterized by its globular shape and dense covering of white, woolly hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, adding a striking contrast to its green foliage. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in full sun and well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in collections.
